Despite the fact that weâve had good -- two good quarters in a row for both attrition in the field and also participation of the field in Customer Identity deals, weâre excited about the momentum, but I also want to be thoughtful given how early we are in the fiscal year. One of the things that we did in this yearâs budget is really focus our investments for those three strategic initiatives that we talked about around solidifying our leadership in Workforce Identity, capturing more of the market in Customer Identity, and then obviously, the scale and automation I just talked about. We still got 11 months left in the year, and we want to make sure that weâre just being thoughtful about all those factors, given...
 Are you seeing any specific things that worry you like, hey, thereâs reasons to believe that new customers are going to further deteriorate relative to what weâre seeing, which I think I heard, sales pipelines look okay? On the workforce side, itâs -- like I mentioned, itâs -- are we going to use the cloud for identity and security and thereâs lots of forces, whether itâs great solutions like Okta, whether itâs just legacy maintenance contracts expiring. Weâre too weighted towards upsells, and thatâs something weâre focused on, but itâs -- and it could be -- itâs definitely like a factor of the macro, but we got to get better at doing new business in the future.
